channel.title: Status Codes :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: The status-line consists of a numeric code, followed by a space, and then a human-readable status message that goes with the code. The codes themselves are 3-digit numbers, with the first number indicating a general category the response status falls into. Essentially, the status code indicates that the request is being fulfilled, or the reason it cannot be. 1XX Status Codes Codes falling in the 100â€™s provide some kind of information, often in response to a HEAD or upgrade request.
